Julie James.Action: Confesses her guilt and heavy burden honestly and seeks spiritual help.

In the lecture hall, despite embarrassment and public laughter, she apologizes politely before leaving.

Reacting to the sudden attack in the priest's office with a loud scream and apparent shock, momentarily losing composure.

Quickly leaves the embarrassing situation in the lecture hall, showing good judgment to remove herself from an uncomfortable environment.

Softens and smiles at Will when he tries to cheer her up, indicating friendly and trusting behavior.
Expresses uncertainty about why she came to visit, indicating possible emotional confusion but still engages openly with Will.

Checks windows and attempts to fix the dripping faucet, then secures snacks and prepares to spend time alone in her room; takes practical steps to ensure safety by checking locks.
When hearing noises at night, turns on the bedside light despite the bulb popping, then quietly arms herself with a knife and moves cautiously toward the source of the noise.
Initially reassures herself to 'face your fears' and moves carefully and silently toward investigating sounds, showing calmness and control.
Eats a handful of chips and then only picks at food while feeling depressed and isolated, eventually turning off the bedside lamp to enjoy natural light—shows some passivity and withdrawal.
